content: Improved distribution of construction payments. Amendment to Section 8007(a) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 to increase funding percentages and eligibility criteria for agencies receiving support payments. The amount of payments to local educational agencies for a fiscal year shall not be less than the appropriated amount divided by the number of children in attendance, including those at specified school facilities. The amount of payments to local educational agencies for a fiscal year is determined by multiplying the appropriated amount by the number of children in attendance, with a minimum of $25,000 and a maximum of $3,000,000, unless the available amount is less than $32,000,000. SEC. 2. COMPETITIVE EMERGENCY AND MODERNIZATION GRANTS. Section 8007(b) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to change the percentage requirements for emergency grants and student enrollment in schools. A local educational agency can receive a grant not exceeding $3,000,000 in any fiscal year under certain conditions. A local educational agency can receive a grant up to $3,000,000 in a fiscal year if eligible under section 8003 and has had an overall increase in enrollment, with a minimum of 250 children from specific categories. The text chunk discusses eligibility criteria for a grant under section 8003, specifically for children who are civilian dependents of Department of Defense employees.
